title: Joe Sugg reacts to Dianne and Dev's shock Strictly Come Dancing exit
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Heartbroken Joe Sugg can't get his head around DJ Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell's Strictly Come Dancing exit.

The popular pair were kicked out of the competition in a bombshell result night few expected.

They were up against Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec, who the judges voted to save.

Fans were seething with rage over the result with many claiming that they had issues with their phone votes.

Dev and Dianne's goodbye didn't just rock those watching at home.

YouTube sensation Joe, the boyfriend of pro dancer Dianne, took to Instagam to tell of his surprise.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

On his story, he posted: "So gutted for these two. They were incredible - honestly so shocked."

Posting a picture of the duo in action, he added: "Tell me how that hip is not a 10?"

On Twitter he uploaded a VAR request - seeming to suggest technology was needed and the the show has scored a serious own goal.

Dev, 34, looked shocked and upset at the news of his departure.

He told host Tess: "I’m not going to lie I am absolutely gutted.

"But learning how to dance, hanging out with Dianne and the other pros and celebs… I’ve absolutely loved it."

(Image: diannebuswell /Instagram)

Fans cried fix with some suggesting they couldn't call in.

But an insider told the Mirror Online : "There were no technical issues, all lines were working. It was just high call volumes, which sometimes happens."

One tweeted: "Please, please complain to @bbcstrictly if you had an issue with your phone votes for @dev_101 and @dbuzz6589 last night!Seems so unfair. #Strictly #strictlyspoiler."

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

While another commented: " Let’s start a petition RETWEET this if you think @dbuzz6589 and dev should stay in the competition due to the phone number not working ! @bbcstrictly #strictlyspoiler #Strictly ❤️

A third remarked: "@bbcstrictly your phone lines for dev and dianne were down yet you allow them to get voted out???? just disgusting. i have no words. #strictly #strictlyspoiler."

*Strictly Come Dancing returns on Saturday 19th October at 6.40pm with the results show on Sunday 20th October at 7.15pm on BBC One
description: He appears to want football review system VAR to overrule the decision to axe his girlfriend and Dev
